title: Cocktail Robotics Grand Challenge: Quarantine Edition, 22 Nov 2020 at DNA Lounge

last_post.content:
@dec23k @gothnbass @Wrecks0 @robin
I fear that our Cocktail Robotics Grand Challenge might be another COVID casualty. Our last one was online, during lockdown in 2020 -- more of a documentary, really, and it was awesome. We put so much work into it! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hG43acu28p4

We tried to do it live again in Nov 2021, but were forced to cancel due to lack of entrants, and we haven't tried again since. I suspect we've now lost the little momentum we had... Too many of our core group have moved away and/or junked their robots.

Everyone loves to *attend* the event, but finding enough *makers* was always a huge challenge.

@Curator @FacemanArt @LoadCake @Hinrt @wobblylines @marceles_pixel @subtlemoss @hokuyu @hovkinnie @Mtomate @tinydharla

We have a lot to learn about how to govern shared spaces better, software or otherwise. What frustrates me, though, about DAO approaches is the lack of awareness of Elinor Ostrom's work (among others). There is Nobel prize winning work in how to collaboratively own resources we could emulate and model. Instead, a subset of VCs is hanging their hat on popularity polls.

Folding Ideas has a great takedown of DAOs (while also sassing the Metaverse) here: https://youtu.be/EiZhdpLXZ8Q?t=4923

#DAO #blockchain

Recently, I uploaded a video from Bell Laboratories, Inc. featuring the first example of synthesized computer speech. Regrettably, this was the first upload of mine to receive a copyright violation. However, this was not due to the content of the record itself, but rather due to someone who had sampled parts of the record and used them in their own song. As far as I understood, YouTube's copyright and content ID match requires original creations that do not contain samples from another recording.

I conducted research to determine who now owned all of Bell Labs' patents and copyrights and discovered that it was Nokia. I was able to submit a form for licensing requests via their website and explained the nature of my channel and the copyright problem I had encountered while trying to showcase their record on YouTube.

To my pleasant surprise, Nokia was incredibly accommodating and granted me a no-charge lifetime license, on the condition that I add the message "Courtesy of Nokia Corporation and AT&T Archives" to the video, which I was more than willing to do.

Unfortunately, this process required me to edit the video and re-upload it. However, it is now up once again, and the copyright has been filed with the claimant, including all details of the license I received from Nokia.

https://youtu.be/HVOo9bhcsH4

#Telephone #Nokia #AT&T #YouTube #Video #Record #Vinyl

What I'm listening to today, "Yay Bahar", Görkem Şen

This is a performance on the Yay Bahar, a fully acoustic instrument Mr. Şen himself invented, perfected and built by hand. It's got some similarity to traditional Turkish bowed instruments but with loose springs and large resonating tubs to act as amplification, echo effect and occasional additional playable element. It sounds Evocative as heck and Şen seamlessly moves from wowing you with weird sounds to violin solo.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CIRTYKuZYu4

title: PLOTCON 2016: Jenny Bryan, Behind every great plot there's a great deal of wrangling

last_post.content: I consider @jennybryan to be a data angel. As proof, here are some screenshots from her 2016 plotcon talk, "behind every great plot there's a great deal of wrangling" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4MfUCX_KpdE. #PlotCon #rstats

On Monday's Oxide and Friends, @bcantrill and I were joined by Oxide colleague, @refugeesus, and Doug Wibben to talk about constructing the Oxide rack's cabled backplane.

Early on we became enamored with the idea of blind-mated sleds with a fixed cabled backplane--just slide in the server and it would hook up to power and networking without any cables to plug, unplug, or mis-plug.

Doug helped us figure out it was possible... and bring the idea to fruition!

https://youtu.be/pJ5_SNKB6LU

title: LTI Colloquium: Green AI- Efficiency in NLP

last_post.content: First was a stellar talk by Jesse Dodge on efficiency in #NLP at the #CMU Language Technologies Institute. From algorithmic efficiency to computing model carbon output to problems with text scraping datasets, there's a ton in this talk. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZFqm7NnRAe0 (2/10) #sustainability #AI

title: Mehdi debates Matt Taibbi on the 'Twitter Files' and Elon Musk

last_post.content:
Mehdi Hassan hosted Matt Taibbi to talk about his “twitter files” “reporting”. It did not go well for Matt. This interview raises only a fraction of the lies and errors the muskrakers have made in this process; some of these, however, were introduced under oath into Congressional testimony.
